ea19.1:1.2: One time, the Buddha was under the bodhi tree in Magadha.
ea19.1:2.1: Soon after he had attained enlightenment, the Bhagavān had this thought:
ea19.1:2.2: “Now, my teaching is profound, hard to understand, hard to comprehend, and hardly recognizable.
ea19.1:2.3: It’s inconceivable, at rest, and subtle.
ea19.1:2.4: It’s recognized by wise people who can discern its purpose and principle.
ea19.1:2.5: Training untiringly, they then will become joyous.
ea19.1:2.6: Supposing I were to explain this wonderful teaching to people, some of them wouldn’t believe it and wouldn’t approve of it.
ea19.1:2.7: It would be a waste, it’d be troublesome, and it’d be for nothing.
ea19.1:2.8: Quietude is what would be fitting for me now.
ea19.1:2.9: What need is there to explain this teaching?”
ea19.1:3.1: It was then that the god Brahmā up in the Brahma Heaven knew the Tathāgata’s thought from a distance.
ea19.1:3.2: In the time it takes a man to flex his arm, he disappeared from the Brahma Heaven and came to the Bhagavān.
ea19.1:3.3: He bowed his head at his feet and stood to one side.
ea19.1:4.1: Brahmā then said to the Bhagavān,
ea19.1:4.2: “Here, Jambudvīpa is sure to be destroyed, and the triple realm will lose its eyes!
ea19.1:4.3: The Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely and Rightly Awakened One has arisen in the world.
ea19.1:4.4: He ought to proclaim the jewel of the teaching, yet he still hasn’t uttered the teaching’s essence.
ea19.1:4.5: May the Tathāgata widely explain the profound teaching to all sentient beings!
ea19.1:5.1: 5. “Moreover, these sentient beings at root are easily liberated.
ea19.1:5.2: If they don’t hear it, they’ll forever miss out on the Dharma vision.
ea19.1:5.3: This is a teaching that should have disciples to inherit it.
ea19.1:5.4: They’re like the blue, red, or white lotus flowers that emerge from mud but haven’t risen above the water and bloomed yet.
ea19.1:5.5: Those flowers slowly grow while they’re under the water.
ea19.1:5.6: Some of them emerge from the water, and some of those have no water clinging to them [afterward they emerge].
ea19.1:5.7: This type of sentient being is likewise.
ea19.1:5.8: They are harassed by birth, old age, illness, and death, and their faculties ripen as a result.
ea19.1:5.9: If they don’t hear the teaching, they’ll still die, but their suffering won’t.
ea19.1:5.11: Please explain the teaching for them, Bhagavān!”
ea19.1:6.1: Because he knew the thoughts in Brahmā’s mind and out of compassion for all sentient beings, the Bhagavān then spoke these verses:
ea19.1:7.3: Those who hear and become devoted believers
ea19.1:7.4: Will discern the profound teaching’s meaning.’
ea19.1:7.5: Like standing atop a high mountain,
ea19.1:7.6: I see all kinds of sentient beings.
ea19.1:7.7: Now that I possess this teaching,
ea19.1:7.8: I’ll ascend the hall and reveal the Dharma vision.”
ea19.1:8.2: “Surely the Tathāgata will explain the profound teaching for sentient beings!”
ea19.1:8.3: He rejoiced and celebrated, unable to control himself.
ea19.1:8.4: He bowed his head at the Buddha’s feet and went back up to his heaven.
ea19.1:9.1: When Brahmā heard what the Buddha taught, he rejoiced and approved.
